review:
Válka robotů začíná. Vytvořte si svého robota jděte bojovat. Ve boji s svým robotem hrajete deatmatch,demolotion,kradení bateri atd . Začínáte jako malý neškodný robot a potom z něj bude nebezpečná legenda. Roboti jsou rozdělený mezi různý třídy takže nemůžete hrát třeba až moc silnými roboty ale někdy jsou vyjimky. Od hlavy až k nohoum a zbraně si vytvoříte vlastního ROBŮTKA. Grafika je pěkná a ani není náročná. Podle mě je to velice povedený
SHRNUTÍ
Vlastní robot +
hezká grafika +
Někdy špatně zařazeno do souboje -

author: {'steamid': '76561198161862385', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1427575607}
review:
Türkçe açıklama pek bulamadım merak edenler için özet geçelim.

Bedava 300 küsür mb. bir oyun öncelikle hemen indirip deneyebilirsiniz.

Basit bir birleştirme-oluşturma sistemi olan robotunuzu yapıp silahlandırıp savaşabildiğiniz yaratıcı ve eğlenceli sayılabilecek bir oyun.

Öncelikle arkadaşlar haksızlık olmasın diye düşünmüş olacak ki parçalar vs. hepsi çok ucuz. İyi oynadığınız bir oyunda 1000 altın kazanabiliyorsunuz. Ve bu parçaların geneli 150-200 altın. Bir iki oyun sonunda İstediğiniz gibi bir robot yapabilirsiniz.

Parçalardan bahsedelim. 

KAFA: herhangi bir + , - yok. Şekil olsun diye çeşitli kafalar var bunlardan seçip robotumuza takabiliyoruz.

GÖVDE: Light-Medium-Heavy sınıfına girmişler. Light zırhlar hafif haliyle dayanıklık değeri düşük, medium orta derece, heavy zırhlar ise çok ağır ve dayanıklılığı yüksek. Bununla birlikte tüm zırh türlerinin 4 silahlı-2 silahlı 2 bataryalı 1 bataryalı seçenekleri var. Bunları deneme yanılma ile oynadıkca değiştirebilirsiniz. Şahsen 4 silahlı medium zırh tercih ettim. 

SİLAHLAR: Light-Medium-Heavy ayrımı burdada devam ediyor. Bunun yanında enerji emen silahlar var. Çok az ingilizce ile silahların açıklamalarını okuyup istediğiniz tarzda silah üretebilirsiniz. Yukarda bahsettiğim medium zırh üstüne, 2 heavy roketatar, 1 medium taramalı, 1 de enerji emen silah koydum. Robotum çok ağır oldu ama verdiği hasar çok fazla.

TEKERLEKLER:Çeşit, çeşit komik mi komik ayaklar mevcut. istediğinizi seçip ( enerji, hız, dayanıklılık olaylarına dikkat ederek) robotumuza yerleştiriyoruz. Sonra robot resminin altında ki TEST tusuna basarak test sürüşüne çıkıyoruz. Burda robotunuzu kısaca test edip, hızına bakabilirsiniz.

Oyun başında ki öğreticiyi kapatmazsanız yararınıza olacaktır. 10 dk lık bir uğraştan sonra silahları nasıl oluşturulacağını buldum. Onuda ekleyeyim incelememe : 

Silah zırh vs. oluşturmak için ilk olarak başlangıç aparatını alıyorsunuz. Daha sonra craft etmek istediğiniz ürünün özelliğine göre tekerleklerde batarya, silahlarda kasa ve özellik, gövde de, motor ve batarya şeklinde ek ürünleri satın alıp birleştiriyorsunuz. Başta bahsetmiş olduğum basit craft sistemi bu şekilde çalışıyor.

Herneyse indirin kurun oynayın. Ben beğendim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149130935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1425708621}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130193229', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3844, 'last_played': 1428387136}
review:
Please read all Cons, Pros and the Conclusion to get a full feel for what the good and bad traits are of this game. 

Cons:
- The matchmaking as of the time of typing this seems to be full of A.I. due to the lack of actual people playing the game, which makes this game lose a lot of it's luster and that " competitive" feel.
- The in-app purchases are both fair and unfair, more unfair than anything else. You have to pay for a ton of sparks to get a VIP account just to have 3 people in your squad ( otherwise you can only have one other person.) Then to unlock nicer paints you have to pay damn near $100, and you have to shell tons of sparks ( the monetary unit used in-game) to increase your inventory size.

BUT..

Pros: 
-I, myself have created a guild and am fortunate enough to have met and collected some great and active players to fight along side with and chat between matches.
- I don't understand what people mean by the game has " unfair combat and ranking system." I have never had my share of win and lose streaks and this game has a pretty fair match making system. 
-Making your robot is fun! there are definitely three styles of bots that you can succeed with. ( heavy, high hitpoint bots/ light, lightning-fast, fast damaging bots, etc)

Conclusion:
-This game is definitely more fun in a guild or with friends! if you are a solo player, this game probably will lose your attention in a matter of hours. give it a chance, if you dont like it, you're not out any money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044416046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1410695860}
review:
Le jeu est vraiment cool, la customization des armes est sympas. Les maps et le gameplay sont vifs et agréables.
Le seul soucis c'est qu'il faut un bon pc (genre vraiment bon) pour y jouer correctement, et qu'il n'y a pas beaucoup de joueurs... (ou alors peut-être que je ne joue pas en même temps que les joueurs).

Je n'y joue plus car mon PC ne supporte pas, mais le jeu en lui-même est vraiment sympa. (surement plus sympas avec des potes)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107232983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1428884030}
review:
Pros - 
Amazing customization 
Side game while match making to keep you not as bored
good concept
cool weapons

Cons- 
Bad fps for even amazing computers
Aim feels shakey 
No smooth gameplay 
bad match making system(I mean horrible)
insane amount of time to kill another robot
weapons are weak
few gamemode types 
cost real money for more inventory space (sparks)
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Over all the game concept is great u can customize ur robot and everything which is what i love but the gameplay is so unsmooth and the aim is so bad the weapons are weak and take about 30 seconds to kill a single robot if there not standing still it has amazing potiential but in its state now i recommend staying AWAY from this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198107526817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1164, 'last_played': 1437440514}
review:
Played it for a little while and enjoyed it without paying anything, duelling is fun when your teammates know how to team up properly.

Rule of thumb is: Pay for inventory slots with the coins you earn whle playing. Once i did that to have inventory room for two builds I spent some of those coins  on some crate and get lucky to get a new shiny love bear rainbow railgun weapon:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=403252862

For 0 EUR/$ there's some free fun to have. So it's a "Yes, give it a try" from my side.

Grinding best starts off with a wise choice of starter build.

I chose an agile long range fighting build and still am using it quite successfully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010483586', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1480968325}
review: ce jeu est vraiment bien ,d'habitude je n'aime ce genre de jeu mais la au bout de 1h de jeu j'ai accrocher et impossible de laisser tomber .biensûr ce jeu a des défaut comme par exemple la création d'un robot sans l'aide d'un tuto(moi perso je ne l'ai pas fait) ,comment faire pour aller plus loin dans les league(je ne comprend toujour pas comment faire) et enfin les équipe completemet déséquilibrer(tu peux tomber contre des lvl 70 alors que tu n'ai que lvl 1) mais il a aussi des points positif comme le gameplay vraiment acrochant et aussi on pourrait croire que c'est un pay2win mais non ! (enfin si un peu pour les amélioration des arme mais si tu fait beaucoup de parti tu peut les améliorer quand meme) apres je ne sais pas si il faut que je le recommande ou pas mais bon ,moi je l'ai aprécier et j'espere que vous l'aprécirer aussi.

review: Сама по себе игра быстро наскучивает, радуют лишь почти безграничные возможности кастомизации. Игра создана для игр с друзьями, тогда и минусов незаметно, и сам процесс становится веселее. В принципе, я бы купил эту игру, если бы она была платной. Free to Play, кстати, тоже плюс. В общем и целом, рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002640038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1425308401}
review:
damn the owners really shekeled out on this one. 

I'll just sort to the history of this game, from their website;
CEO Bagoyil Steinboch created his game in Isreal for one goal, shekels and gold. He poured all of his greed, and hate for man kind into this creation, he called it one thing. One thing he muttered to himself while sleeping every night.. In his private plane, in his limo, in his own mansion. He whispered to him self... " shekels ".

Bagoyil later on created the game " Guns and Robots " but he realized after his first 80 million USD made from his work, it wasn't enough. He then went on to go full jew tactics and realesed deals, market deductions and a array of campaign ads for his game, Guns and Robots. He advertised, deals of a century, almost gaining you, the consumer money! But little did the paying customers soon to find out, it was all a sham... The deals where actually deductions of -5%.

The guerilla marketing scheme that Bagoyil had thought to be his riches, became his his god-hood in the jewish community. He created a thing, no.. A machine. He created what he always wanted all along, what he and his family dreamed of making all along. He dreamed, of making a SHEKEL GENERATOR.

With this creation he made, he was held as a demigod in his local jewish community, they all held him in the highest regards! But even with his billionare status gained from a simple video game, he still did not spare one penny, nor a shekel to his starving village of jewish family. 

Later that month, all of his family, friends and village died of starvation and some say, you can still hear Bagoyil laughing to this very day. " muahahha... hahhahaha.. HAHAHAHA...... shekels. ༼ຈل͜ຈ༽ ".

It later came out that year that the owner of this game was actually Gabe Newell the whole time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198142225346', 'num_games_owned': 2044, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 40315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38209, 'last_played': 1475047169}
review:
Кто бы что не говорил, но игра затягивает очень сильно. Можно залипнуть очень надолго. 
Игра Free-to-Play - каждый может в неё поиграть и попробовать.
Игра НЕ ЗАСТАВЛЯЕТ нас Донатить, можно спокойно играть без него.
Приятная атмосфера и стилистика игры.
Мультяшная анимация.
Легкое управление для клавиатуры.
Русский язык добавлен :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198111671587', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5876, 'last_played': 1424360363}
review:
It's a pretty good game, I enjoy it and you can play free easily enough, a bit of balencing still needs to be done ( Railgunners, I'm staring you down) but for the most part it's good with a wide vietey of weapons with each one working a bit differently from the last, I'd say give it a shot and see if it's some thing you can get behind

P.S. Also save your Sparks, you get flooded with them at the start and you really should use them to upgrade your inventory slots,bigger inventory = more robots= more veriety = all around more experienced player = finding what your best with fastest = getting picked up by a good guild = a great time

author: {'steamid': '76561198063930115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1422391719}
review:
first of all, i'd recommend this as a free game for about 15 minutes before moving on to something better. however, some things are probably going to frustrate you like the horrible team balancing that will pit you against bots that could kill you even with a 3 year old smashing a keyboard just because of sheer unbalanced power. your skills just won't matter. this will continue forever, simply because you didn't start when they did, or you didn't spend outragous money to  build the baddest bot, or a combination of both. which brings us to the money issues.

 the biggest problem with recommending this (at least to anyone intending on spending money) is the incredible scamminess and greed of the microtransaction system in this game. a game developer giving so little for your money, and lying about the real usefulness of many of the things you're buying should be sued for fraud. things like the multitool, that operates like a key to open crates of random items, says 5% chance of opening one of the easiest ones, which should be approximatly 1 in 20 tries, very consistantly ended up being more like 1 in 50 tries, or 2%. the difference between the two, amounts to how many people spend real money on it, before they get something from the crates that isn't total crap. i see people realisticly spending 100's of dollars without getting anything worth having, with the transaction being based on an outright lie.

this might be free, but it's very much pay to win, with very little chance, otherwise. i just can't recommend this, unless you love being abused in pvp games, or have unlimited access to someone else's money. even then, go spend that money on a better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988428606', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1423106556}

A pretty funny game. If you like the idea of customizing your character as much as you want, you will like it for sure.
The game is still kinda new, so the community is still kinda small, and expect some stuff that still needs to be balanced, but oposing to what some people say, it's definitely not "pay to win".

author: {'steamid': '76561198034873474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1467088775}
review:
Добротно выполненная игра, но...
Пожалуй, главным минусом является то, что основной акцент геймплея сделан именно на кастомизации своего персонажа, а не на самом игровом процессе. Сам же геймплей несколько ограничен: роботы могут только двигаться вперёд-назад-влево-вправо, иногда падая с высоты там, где это позволяют немногочисленные боевые арены, никаких прыжков и пригибаний. Сами арены выполнены качественно, вот только сделали их всего шесть, отчего страдает разнообразие!
Для любителей "побегать-пострелять" будет немного скучновато, учитывая что есть тот же бесплатный "Team Fortress 2" или "Quake Live", да и много чего ещё подобного, но менее примитивного.
Игра стоит того, чтобы на неё посмотреть изнутри, но мне хватило трёх часов, чтобы наиграться и удалить её с диска навсегда.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084452848', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1490975275}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036662815', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1421168227}
review:
Guns and Robots is a blasty blast to play.  The customization for your robots (you get two to start off with) is ridiculously fun to mess around with.  Only major complaint I have about this game--aside from limited inventory (worse with multiple robots)--is that the player base is almost completely gone.

I recommend this game but wish that more people played it!  I hate seeing good games go under!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987536858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1420589755}
review:
Seemed like a fun game when i picked it up, tutorial was a bit lacking but i never let that stoped me.
then i went to do some matches (5 of them before i deinstalled the game), and oh boy was that a horrible experience.
I'm not sure if this game even has a matchmaking system, but every opponent kicked my ass.
And not just by a little, it felt like my weapons barely dented the opponent (the health bar went down so slowly it might as well not have been) whereas i had trouble surviving even a few shots.

overall it felt like the game tried to get real life money from me on almost every turn, now i don't mind f2p games to have some moneytization but this game just feels (and as you can see i haven't played that mutch, so it's just my opinion) like a pay2win game.

If You're looking for a game which probably needs a TON of time to get decent and fun, this might be it. if not, don't even bother installing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069082219', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1420564494}
review:
sa sembler prometteur mais perso je le déconseil , je sais pas si c'est des bug ou si c'est super mal foutus mais deja le robo de base tu le démonte , tu va pour en remonter un et les piece que etait sur ton robot son en "in use" donc imposible de les utiliser a nouveau , pourtant elle son dans l'inventaire (qui est limité en slot bien sur) , mais pas moyen de les utilisé.

Sinon a mon 3eme match je suis tomber sur un mec qui a cliquer 2 fois sur sa sourie => 2 kill , match perdu , donc soit c'est super mal équilibré , soit c'est pay to win , soit c'est hack.

review:
I think Guns And Robots is a great game to hop in and enjoy for the following reasons;

1# It's easy enought.

2# It's got loads of weapons from crazy dynamite throwing flaks to high accuracy laser snipers.

3# There are more reasons why it's a great game but you're going to have to peel and feel them yourself!

Olso I think this game need a lot more attention, sadly enought, I can't help it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102445842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1424006057}
review:
Отличная игра, все-что может пожелать любой геймер:
-Донат не создает дисбаланса!
-Огромный выбор пушек, соответственно есть миллиарды кустомизаций для роботов!
-Геймплей так себе нужно уничтожить команду противника, но стоит того, т.к. тянет к новым оружиям!
-Щедрость! Сдесь каждый день заходишь получаешь от 200 монет, а еще с новым уровнем премия +1000, за бой примерно 160-300 монет.
-Команда! Играть с другом в сверх-веселую игру, ваншотя по-очереди то с ракетницы, то с дробовика, то с лазера, то с ПП? Легко!
Единственные минусы: Маленькая команда, Нет Русского языка, поэтому новичкам будет трудно учиться создавать пушки, корпусы и ходовые части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063158553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2411, 'last_played': 1419421303}
review:
There are many things wrong with this game. 

1. This game has tiers, like in Robocraft, so you aren't supposed to be put with people who will annihilate you in one shot. However, I was put in a match with one of the top 10 players on the enemy team. They one-shotted me, and later, two others, on my team. To put this into context, destroying an enemy robot in this game can take over 10 seconds of non-stop fire. 

2. As I mentioned before, this game has tiers. But you can only 'tier-up' when you upgrade your robot's parts. However, the only thing upgrading parts does is give them more health, except weapons, which get more damage as well as more health. This means, in higher tiers, your robot will have more health and do more damage. This also means every other robot will have more health and do more damage. What's the point? Am I missing something?

3. There is no progression in this game. Yes, you can upgrade your robot, but as I said, the whole 'upgrading' system is linear and useless. 

4. There are very few people playing it. Getting into a match doesn't usually take any more than about 30 seconds, but being put into matches with, quite often, the same people, who are quite often, using the same robot each time, can get repetitive, especially when they use over-powered weapons. 

5. You will occasionally get a box as a reward after completing a match. You can open these boxes with credits, the in-game currency, with a success rate as low as 0.25%, upto 5%. Failed attempts will not destroy the box, only the tools. You can alternatively pay real money in exchange for 'sparks', which you can use to open the box first time. This wouldn't be a problem if it weren't for the fact that these crates can give unique robot parts. That's right, people who pay real money get an advantage over those who don't. 

Personally, I have enjoyed this game so far, but I simply cannot recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029456924', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1418663564}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985795807', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1418674811}
review:
At present, Guns And Robots is more than a bit of an unbalanced mess. The game divides up robots you create into weight classes and 'Tier' ranks, in an attempt to make sure that any robot you design will never face down a robot considered to be 'more powerful' or in a higher 'weightclass'. Unfortunately this system is extremely broken and is constantly getting exploited by experienced players so they can game the system and earn fast coin.

The basic issue is that right now.. since robots are so highly customizable, every individual part needs to be invidually 'scored' based upon its power curve and over all effectiveness. Two Dragonov (Spelling?) Sniper Rifles, while considered Heavy Weapons, can actually be bolted onto a light weight robot chassis and have only minimal impact on your over all speed. This allows for high speed, high maneuverability designs that still pack a heck of a damage _punch_. This problem compounds even further when you move up from a 2-Weapon Robot Frame to a 4-Weapon Robot Frame. 4 Sniper Rifles, or 4 Hailfire Rocket Launchers basically allow you to faceroll over most of the competition, yet still somehow keep your robot ranked in the "Tier 1" ("Lightweight") groupings. 

If you want a 'build your own robot' game with a ranking system that WORKS, go try "RoboCraft". "Guns And Robots", at present, is an unbearable mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981570523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1419237546}

１試合５分程度の、対人マルチゲー。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983500879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1416588668}
review:
It has it's good notes and a few bad, overall, would play again.

Starting with the good.

Arena style gameplay, is generally fast paced and fun.
Cusomization process is simple and streamlined, this stock with this barrel gives you this weapon
Each size class has it's own strengths and weaknesses.

The Bad.

Certain weapons have some balance issues. Long range shotgun rocket launcher that is deadly at any range would be a good example.
No players que up for higher teir bot battles, tiers are working, just seems like everyone stops progression at 2


Overall it is a wellbuilt microtransaction based free to play arena.  No cash needed but you have to pay for the hats.

review: Nuž ako som sa k tejto hre dostal :D Niekde bol giveway tak som automaticky bez čítania vykonával pokyny. Keď už som mal hru stiahnutú zistil som, že som dostal nejaký klobúčik. Videl som veľa záberov z Borderlands tak si myslím že majú podobnú grafiku a páči sa mi to. author: {'steamid': '76561198097683704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1414329751}
review: Kedy zauważyłem tą gre miałem wielkiego banana na twarzy! Bo lubie takie gdzie się buduje jakiegoś robota a potem leci na pojedynek! Coś jak RoboCraft! Lecz wszystko co o tej grze myślałem to pomyłka! Ta produkcja ma wiele do życzenia! Grafika mimo że była wzorowana na gafice z Borderlads nie spełniła tak wielkiego zadania jak w tej owej grze! Muzyka poprostu bije mnie prosto w twarz a podczas rozgrywki męczy moje uszy PUM PUM PUM! Ale przejdźmy do rozgrywki która nie jest dobra! Roboty poruszają się jagby miały zatwardzenie. Na dodatek ich wyposarzenie jest tak słabe że żeby zabić jakiegoś przeciwnika trzeba najpierw wyposarzyć się w dużą ilość baterii do myszy (jak ktoś ma bezprzewodową). Krótko mówiąc: ,,Jeśli grasz już z 1 godzine i jeszcze nikogo nie zabiłeś to wiec że coś się dzieje!" 34/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198025282168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1415441955}
review:
Right off the bat, the guns feel awkward to aim. What makes this worse is that for the first hour or so of play, your weapons will feel like PEASHOOTERS. Even when i had enough cash to purchase a flamethrower that the shop said dealt "heavy dps close up", i was point blank shooting with it for 10 seconds, and they showed no signs of damage.

The module system is confusing to get in to, as instead of just buying weapons, this game sneakily makes you purchase weapon PARTS (two, to be fair.) The same for all other main robot parts; everything comes in 2 pieces.

For a free game, and with only 800 mb, it isn't the worst. But still not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160835480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1416110254}
review: Guns And Robots:Это замечательная игра Аркада,уровни,ну и все чтобы повеселится

author: {'steamid': '76561198034063409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1414956570}
review:
Oooh, Guns and Robots... It is such a shame how unpopular you are. Sure, you are not the greatest game out there, suffering a number of issues both big and small... But deep down there is a fun game here.

Alas, what holds G&R back so hard is it's balancing and small, unsocial community. With any game that allows you to build your own weapon, there are bound to be dirty players who exploit this fact and abuse it to create frustrating builds that take the fun out of the game and either force you to build your own cheap build, or just attempt to tough it out and try your best to beat them (And if you have skills, chances are you will at the very least do a considerable amount of damage to their bot). 

As for the community, there is hardly anyone left... On average, there is probably around 150-100 players daily, if you are lucky.. Often this means fighting the same people over and over (said people probably being the cheap builds that frustrate you so), meaning it gets dull seeing the same robot over and over, nothing new and creative coming your way, and even worse for noobs to the game who get put together with level 80 vets. Even moreso, the community is very quiet for the most part, not much chattering going on between players, which further makes the game feel empty.

Does this mean the game isn't worth playing? Hell naw, when I first started playing, I really enjoyed it. It is fun making your own personal robot that suits your playstyle, mixing and matching parts and painting them all up to make a fancy killing machine that people will easily remember and adore/fear, and when you join a guild, it is fun working together to gather enough money to help invest in the guild to purchase buffs that give you a slight edge against your rivals. That, and the fact that this is the most generous F2P game I played in a long time, where all the things you can buy with real money don't have serious impact in the game, keeping it fun for everyone.

If you do plan on playing this, though, I suggest you bring some friends... It is much more fun when you have a crew you can rely on instead of having to go solo and risk having to be paired up with bots... yeah...

author: {'steamid': '76561198084077153', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1414574754}
review:
Die Roboter sind hübsch gemacht und die Umgebung ist wirklich putzig. Wenn man das mag, ist dieses Spiel wirklich nicht zu verachten. Im genaueren Detail werde ich dieses Spiel mit Robocraft vergleichen, da sich beide Titel ähneln.


Das Tutorial ist recht kurz, meiner Meinung nach unnötig. Das Spiel ist sehr selbsterklärend

Man wird zufällig in ein Team gesteckt und spielt dort bis alle Tot sind oder man gewonnen hat. Vergleichbares Prinzip mit Robocraft, wobei man in Guns and Robots mehr Spielprinzipien hat. Bsp Catch the Flag und Sudden Death

Man kann sich die Roboter in Guns and Robots aus quasi Bausätzen zusammen schustern. Zb Waffenart + Waffenhülle = Waffe
Unterschiede im Design kann man so annähern. An Robocraft kommt es hier nicht ran, dort setzt man jedes mikro Teil selbst. Folglich kann es kaum ein Double geben, wenn man nicht bewusst kopiert.

Im Spiel kann man die einzelnen Teile der Gegner abschießen. Das erzeugt gewisse Mali beim Leidenden, beispielsweise eine Waffe weniger oder einbüßung der Zielgenauigkeit weil es den Kopf erwischt hat.
In Robocraft läuft dies vergleichbar ab, dort nur mit mehr Einzelheiten. Beispielsweise mit nur noch einem Rad kann man sich dort sehr wohl noch mehr oder weniger "gut" bewegen. In Guns and Robots wird man einfach nur langsamer.


Meiner Meinung nach ein gelungenes Spiel, jedoch tendiere ich weiterhin zur vergleichbaren Alternative Robocraft. Jeder sollte wenn er dies hier liest beide Spiele einmal testen, kosten tun sie schließlich erstmal beide nichts ^^

review:
I actually really enjoyed this game. Its like the combination of robocraft and boarderlands. The robot parts are all modular which allows players to customize how ever they want their robot to look like and perform that they disire. 

I still find some flaws to the game but overall it is quite playable and enjoyable. It does have a few very minor lags and the game needs to have more variety robot parts for players to choose from to build their robot. 

If you are into playing a unique or a combination mixed game. Then I recommend this to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997632863', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1414337073}
review:
One of the worse games I've had the honer of playing. The concept is great but its anything from playable.
The three mayor concerns with this game is.

A. There is no matchmaking to speak off. The game tries to put up equal teams but it cant so every game is stacked and one team ALWAYS rampages the other.
B. The game is mostly played (as most f2p) by east block players and Russians on their dial up modems with even ISP on dial up modems. Result a good base of players warps all over the map and abuses this by using high speed bots.
C. There are hundreds and hundreds of bots to combine out of several different parts, alas there are only about 3 viable concepts that everyone uses. So youlle constantly face the same bots and the only way to beat them is using the same bots and getting the drop on them.

It is however free to play so I wouldnt say not to give it a try. The microtransaction system is extremely fair and well implemented (big thumbs up there). Compiling your bot out of different components however is rather puzzling as there are quite a few stats and they arent very easy to compare (also see remark C).
Another big thumbs up is map design. They are very very small, but extremely well designed making them a pleasure to play as they make use of the Y axes unlike any game Ive seen before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011735295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1412607117}
review:
Добротно выполненная игра, но...
 Пожалуй, главным минусом является то, что основной акцент геймплея сделан именно на кастомизации своего персонажа, а не на самом игровом процессе. Сам же геймплей несколько ограничен: роботы могут только двигаться вперёд-назад-влево-вправо, иногда падая с высоты там, где это позволяют немногочисленные боевые арены, никаких прыжков и пригибаний. Сами арены выполнены качественно, вот только сделали их всего шесть, отчего страдает разнообразие!
 Для любителей "побегать-пострелять" будет немного скучновато, учитывая что есть тот же бесплатный "Team Fortress 2" или "Quake Live", да и много чего ещё подобного, но менее примитивного.
Игра стоит того, чтобы на неё посмотреть изнутри, но мне хватило трёх часов, чтобы наиграться и удалить её с диска навсегда.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983558838', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1412424657}
review: When I got this game (Thank le flying sphaghetti monster it was free), I loved it. Making your own robot, your own Man o' War? THIS WAS THE GAME IS WAS LOOKING FOR. The Mechanics are great, the only problem I have is the Robot Speed. Now, having two robots, which of one made to Skirmish, (Which has all light Components, not including Battery), Is kind of slow, despite me even using the Turbine Engine (Or that's what I remembered, I'm playing the game after I finish this), Which I don't get, because my other robot has 4 arms, and Heavy everythin', and It's almost as fast as my Skirmish. That's pretty much it, I guess. I tip my fedora to the developers, for I can quickscope casual scrubs with almost any weapon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115313972', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1411584153}
review:
Very unhappy about this game.
Okay, Guns and Robots, failed to explain to me how to let Guns and Robots work well together. This can be seen by trying to let me waste my currency just to trial and error for the right robot. Moreover is inventory limitation, forcing players just to sell mistakes and suffer a lots just to get back gold. Sometimes ended up with too slow robot or too cranky robot. 

The tutorial just not awesome and helpful at all, sadly. As well as user-friendliness for customization, found it much more annoying when trying to deattach devices and creating certain module.

Much more rage-quit in the real match. I just feel certain build is very over-powered. Not because of upgrade, but is because of rare weapon or crazy 4-weapons built. Only the players who played can explain this.

This game should be categorized as Early-access, seriously. Lag of play-testing.

review:
το παιχνιδι ειναι ΧΑΛΙΑ!!!!! 
Μειονεκτιματα
-δεν εχει respawn
-για να σκοτοσεις κπ πρεπει να το πυροβολας 10 ωρες

author: {'steamid': '76561197962897243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2215, 'last_played': 1412232098}
review:
Good game - Good concept - Greedy Developers

The game in itself is fun and enjoyable.  However the developers are too greedy and as a result ruined the experience.  

When I say 'sparks', it means bought currency.  

Two major gripe I have with this game:

[b]Inventory Slots[/b]
The one biggest problem I have is inventory slots.  You start off with a tiny inventory which requires 'Sparks' to unlock FIVE slots.  Then each additional unlock, the amount of spark needed to unlock an additional five slots becomes higher.

Currently I have 40 slots in my inventory and to unlock the next 5 slots, it will cost me $4+.  Even parts you have equipped on robots count towards inventory so this gets filled up very quickly.

[b]Robot Slots [/b]
So you unlock a robot slot with sparks.  But wait, they limit your inventory so you can't build anything with your new robot slot!  Thus making you spend on inventory in addition to buying new robot slots.  

[b]Crates[/b]
You would think the game had enough money sink?  No.  When you win matches you have a chance to get crates.  To stand a chance to open these crates you will have to use sparks otherwise the picklocking tool has 0.1% ~ 5% chance depending on crate level.  I have no problem with this in games but when you add in the other two money sinks then this makes the game have a bad f2p model.

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Stay away from this game unless the developer gets their head out of the gutter.  Too many money sink.  With the inventory limit it literally forces you to use sparks to progress.  Yes you do get sparks in-game but no where near enough to make the game enjoyable on being free.  I have no problem spending cash on a f2p game but there are too many money sink that are not really optional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003885897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1411784716}
review:
I played the game for almost an hour.

Good things:
the tutorial was very basic and very quick before letting you get to the main game play.

Bad things:
I can't express how much this game is a pay-to-win game.
I started my first fight with a bunch of people who were supposedly my level, but seemed to have energy shields, boosts out the wazoo and were super armored.  Most everyone carries around high damage explosive weapons and the fight zones tend to be enclosed areas, so...yeah.

The amount of enjoyment I got out of this game and the amount of progress I felt I made could be best stated as the equivalent of banging your head against a brick wall.   Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023525468', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1412652846}
review:
Kind of reminds me of Loadout, but with Battlebots.  Mixing and matching parts is fun to be a tank, a skirmisher, or a sniper, or a combination of any of them.  Matches are fast-paced and generally over pretty quickly.  Plus there's a minigame during the lobby screen to keep you busy.  8/10 would free-to-play again.

Updated after several days of play: The game is pay-to-win.  Sometimes this is not bad; but in this case, do not give the devs any real money.  First of all, you make money fast enough without resorting to cash payment.  Second of all, the devs don't seem particularly active on the topics discussion, updates, hotfixes, patches, hacking, and cheating.  I'd like to know the devs are actually improving the game before I give them money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028443050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2315, 'last_played': 1410766276}
review:
The gameplay is rather fun.  When you can actually play.  Several issues make this difficult, some part of the game and others the players.

There are three game types, though two are rather similar.  Capture the Batteries and Plant the Bomb are games designed on moving something from your base to theirs or the other way around.  Capture the Batteries has you go to their base to claim one of two batteries to return it to your base.  Only one battery spawns at a time and capturing has no regard for where your own are.  Plant the Bomb has you take a bomb to their base and put it on their totem.  You defend the bomb until it explodes or you go back to your own base to disarm a bomb if they have planted.

I would have no issues with these two types of games if nearly every one I've played didn't end up being about the third game type.  For those types of games there should be respawns and it shouldn't end until those objectives are finished.  Instead it comes down to who can blow away the other team first.  Destroy the other Team is the third type of game and it's how all games seem to play out.

Why would we bother doing complicated battery and bomb objectives if destroying them works just as well?  Beyond that issue is the reward system for playing games.  You get the same random rewards for winning or losing.  I've often gotten better rewards from losing a match then winning.

There is a repair and ammo replacement system that costs in-game currency.  This would actually be a concern if each match didn't make enough coin to pay for both every time.  I don't see a point to these systems if even a lost game gives enough money to deal with it.  All this does is govern your profit from a game, which is rather random anyway.

The queue system is another problem.  I can no longer count how often I have been put in a group with or matched against someone far below my robot level.  A one or two level difference isn't really enough to notice but when I'm 5 and they are 1 it becomes the difference of me shooting once or ten times for a kill.  It seems to be a practice for level 4 and 5 robots to group with level 1 robots, forcing them into matches one or the other shouldn't be in.

In match group balancing seems to be firstly priortized by robot level (which is good) and secondly by personal level (which is bad).  This comes up often.  If four level 5 robots are queued then it makes a match of 2v2.  It will then use the levels of the people to balance the teams.  Personal levels determine, without spending the real money sparks on, what parts you can upgrade to which point.  So in that instance it makes sense.  But then we get a match with four level 5 robots and two level 3 robots.  It will make a full group of the level 5 robots and put the others together because the personal levels of the level 3 robots is higher then some of the level 5 robots.  With some variation of individual part levels, this puts a heavy toll on the lower level group.

Upgrading parts changes your robot level.  A level 1 robot will generally have all level 1 parts.  You can have higher level parts and still be a lower level if you don't upgrade some parts or even take off some.  So I can go into a level 1 match with my mostly all level 6 parts simply by dropping most of my guns and special ability parts.  Even at one gun of two or of four, that level difference is enough to blow them away.  This seems to be a common problem with leveled games and I don't really have a fix for it.

The speed at which I upgraded didn't feel that slow or fast.  I played matches to get upgrade parts and money and then the parts would upgrade while I was sleeping.  Building new parts and the robot as a whole seemed easy enough.  You have a build platform that you simply start slapping parts on.  There is a blue transparent version of the part to help guide you.  You can even upgrade a part as you are using it, leaving less need to stop playing just to wait on one part.

You start with a basic robot and a slot for a second robot.  Additional slots can be purchased with Sparks (real money).  Now while you have room for two robots you do not start with enough inventory space for all those parts.  You can build one robot, the one you start with, and that's it.  Buying more inventory room starts at a simple 10 sparks, somthing that you start with.  This gives you enough space to either upgrade your robot or get a few off parts.  The next space buy is 85.  After that it's 160(unsure of the exact number only that it was way up there).  For a game that talks so much on customizability this is horrible.

In it's entirety I would not conclude that this game is pay to win.  However, some elements are in the game that certainly make it headed in that direction.  The better crates you can get either with Sparks or by chance after matches contain arm peices that allow two or three weapons to be attached to them.  It is horribly expensive to get these as it is only a chance to get them per crate, but it is still there.  They can certainly claim it is possible to open these crates with the coin bought crate openers but at a 0.01% chance to open there is little point.

From what I could find the only thing that is ONLY purchasable by Sparks are the paint colors used to customize your robot.  You start with a few blah colors and can buy more at outragous prices PER color.

I wouldn't say this game is unplayable by any means.  But there is a lot that needs to be done to make it a fun and stable environment.  Everything from the basic robot construction to Spark purchases needs to be reworked to allow for a smoother time in the game.  I'm all for them making their money but it is currently too spikey in prices.

In closing I will add this one tip:  To detach a single part from your robot be in build mode and click the part so it is highlighted then click the detach button below the robot.  To do this to the ability parts you will need to rotate the camera to see them and then do as the other parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999813601', 'num_games_owned': 802, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2794, 'last_played': 1412908998}
review:
I enjoy playing this game, but there are too many annoying elements for me to recommend it in good conscience to other people. Though if you want to subject yourself to rubberbanding foreign players, peak-a-boo cloaked shotgun/aoe players, and instagib builds, then by all means this is the game for you. And yes I know it's hypocritical to criticize instagib builds when I use one myself, but you have no choice unless you just plan on dying all the time.

The devs need to take a long, hard look on weapon balance and the overall [fun] factor of the game if they want to retain players. They actually have one of the best, if not the best F2P model I've seen and it's a crying shame the game eventually becomes such a frustrating experience. And yes this game is a frustrating experience if you aren't rubberbanding. Think about that for a moment before considering to download and play this great game.

PS: Don't believe me about rubberbanding? Go fire up a download/upload to choke your bandwidth and see how you magically live longer while at the same time having negligible effect on your aim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988952844', 'num_games_owned': 1922, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1410499159}
review:
Honestly, I would recommend against this game, for the time being anyway.

The art style, the sounds, the various interesting maps, and the sheer amount of customization is great in this game, but it falls prone to one thing being better than the others in just about all cases. I built the heaviest possible robot, with automatic machine guns on both hands, and I've been getting the majority (if not all) of the kills in every game, and haven't lost once.

That brings me to another point, regardless of the game mode that you're playing, the game devolves into a deathmatch battle, because killing the enemies makes you win anyway. There's no respawn, and you often get thrown into 2 v 2 games to make matchmaking quick, so games last all of a minute or two at most. Nobody even bothers with the objectives, let alone acting as a team.

Anyway, all of these things can be looked over while playing the game. Short matches? You get to play with more games. Ideal build? Cool, more kills for you. With just this stuff, I would recommend the game, because it's a bit of quick fun. However, there is one problem that really makes this game a drag, and that's progression.

There's nothing in this game to really make you keep playing it. You can level up by getting experience from battles, but leveling up only allows you to upgrade your equipment to a higher level. Upgrading equipment requires money and parts, and the parts cost Sparks. You can only get Sparks by paying for them with real money, or (guess what), leveling up. You play battles so that you can play more battles to get the stuff so you can upgrade stuff to play more battles. This isn't fun or interesting, this is just grinding for the sake of grinding. Why would I bother upgrading my stuff so I can win more games, when I'm already winning games in order upgrade the stuff?

Anyway, this is an interesting game to try for a little while, but don't expect to be playing it for more than a few hours. Maybe a little longer if you have some friends. If you want something similar that actually rewards progress, go play Robocraft or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120329707', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1410122064}
review: This game, even though I have only played it for a few minutes, is rather unbalanced. When you first get your robot, you get these tiny little peashooters (Thats what they feel like, anyway) that only do up to 8 damage (this is the most I saw) and almost no armor to stand in combat with. Then, once your done with the tutorial, you almost instantly forced to fight other players with weapons that can kill your robot instantly. Once you die, you're out of the match, and you have to repair your robot (I haven't noticed what you lose yet, sooooo.... yea) and then you have to jump back into another match.  The only thing about this game I liked was that, while waiting for a match, you can play a little game while waiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098412332', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1411024954}
review:
It's a fun game, but I don't think it's something you should play too often.

I downloaded this game because the size is quite small (only 800 MB or so). It's similar to Robocraft: you build and cutomize your own robot, generally it's either going to be a hard-beating tanker or swift recon, but there are variations in between. The customization aspect of this game is quite nice.

The battles, too, are amusing enough actually. However, things could get quite frustrating when you are faced with a four-armed heavy tanker opponent (you normally only got two arms)... which is able to kill you under 10 secs. Though to be fair they're still manageable with a good teamwork (3-4 people need to flank him at once), the problem is when there are TWO of these kind in the opposing team. The team only consists of 5 people at most, so if the opponent have two insta-killers you are practically doomed.

Without those crazy OP guys though, the game is fine. The maps are well-designed so that give swift recon robots opportunity to surprise buttsecs anytime. And while there is an IRL-bought-currency here (especially useful for upgrading weapons and providing slots for robot customization), you can still win the currency in matches. Even the OP four-arm customization is buyable with in-game cash/through winning matches.

However you're going to meet those OP four-arm robots often, so expect loses. I personally note and remember each OP guys' name and quit the lobby everytime those guys are present, but this isn't too practical, so I don't suggest playing this game too frequently.

With its small size, it's still worthy to stay in your HDD; it's a good time-killer, but you'll know when to stop when you face those OP robots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024505428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1411075028}
review:
cooles game, koennte spass machen, wenn da nicht die inventar begenzug waere.
die begenzung der freien roboter auf 2 finde ich noch voll in ordnung die begenzung vom inventarplatz auf 20 jedoch ganz und gar nicht...

das erste upgrade auf 25 inventar-slots kostet 10 sparks (echtgeldwaehrung) das zweite schon 85!

schon bei den zwei robottern stoesst man selbst bei 25 slots schnell an seine grenzen.
eine waffe besteht aus je zwei einzelteilen da verbraucht man bei einem roboter mit 4 waffen direkt schon 8 slots allein fuer die waffen.

dadurch kann man nicht sonderlich viel ausprobieren, ausser man verkauft seinen alten kram, wofuer man allerdings beim verkaufen 0 zurueckbekommt.

auch der umfang der anpssungsmoeglichkeiten des roboters ist eher moderat wuerde aber denke ich mit ein bisschen mehr moeglichkeit zum austesten trotzdem ganz lustig sein.

daher kann ich das spiel nicht empfehlen, da ich nicht genug austesten kann ob mir das spiel wirklich gefaellt bevor ich den geldbeutel zuecken muss/moechte

author: {'steamid': '76561198089766951', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1558795650}
review:
At first look, this game seems mediocrely entertaining and sometimes fun depending on the user. However, after some experience with the game, the game has come down, quite a lot. The game is good on the gameplay side but in the multiplayer ranking system, the game doesn't do that well. For example, If you are a new player who joined the game and you are just expecting to have fun, well, don't have your hopes high. Because the game is randomly ranking you, you might end up with a severely high-ranked team, which you will have no chance against. This isn't a one-time thing either, it can happen anywhere, anytime. 

That said, I still enjoy this game, due to good players, and such. But if you want feedback, look below-

. Pros .

1. Good gameplay

2. Entertaining for long periods

3. Good controls and graphics

. Cons .

1. Can get quite frustrating. [Depends]

2. Glitches here and there. [Sometimes]

3. High usage of bad language by players, not the "normal bad language". Some which are personal. [Sometimes]

. Suggestions .

. Improve the ranking system [Foremost important]

. Disallow usage of same weapon 4 times, this is another issue i've seen where people use high powered weapons to destroy you easily. [Secondary importance]

That's all for now, if you do these things, I assure this game will be one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020532649', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1409460029}
review:
At first I thought this game was going to be fun.  Building robots and marching them into battle.  Sounds good right?

In two days I leveled past 20.  I estimate I was doing above average.

However, in that time I started to notice wildly mismatched games happening.  I started to notice wildly OP weapons -- I'm talking weapons that could literally one or two shot me when in quad configuration -- and I was running a fully geared and very slow (as a result) heavy build with 5 levels of armor throughout, etc.  It seemed like that should have meant something.

Well, it doesn't.  

There are severe imbalances throughout Guns and Robots and it's a Pay2Win game along the same lines that World of Tanks is.  It might not be SEVERE pay2win, but it's still there, just like WoT.  It's a damn shame.

This model of game is also designed to create addiction.

So, I uninstalled it.

Your experience will vary, but I cannot recommend this game.  I typically end up locking such games or uninstalling them, and in this case, since the balance is nowhere near as good as WoT, and because the game itself has a paltry inventory space that's basically begging you to pay money to field more than one robot, the variety isn't even close to WoT, where you can field a half-dozen tanks easily without feeling anyone pinching your wallet, etc.: Guns and Robots earned an uninstall.

I'm just tired of this sort of game design.  It's all shiny, candy-coated and looks good on the outside, but once you start chewing on it, it leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019588002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1411401714}
review:
GaR is a fun little free to play shooter with a quirky art style.

So far there is a good few hours of discovering the game, but past that it's just general arena combat like so many others. The game isn't revolutionizing any systems. They are all basically how you would expect them from other games, just catered to cartoony robots. 

The game currently has balancing issues with the weapons, there are a few hackers here and there, and the learning curve can be steeper simply because you can end up fighting players who've played hours of the game right from the get go with GaR's robot ranking system. All of this can be considered a challenge, but might not be worth it to some.

For a free to play game, I'd say it's worth a look, though the game still needs more work done on it.

review: Guns & Robots is an awesome game. It's gameplay is good, the customisability is excellent, the parts are cool and it is extremely fun. To just shoot the weapons off an enemy robot and destroy their chassis, rendering them helpless and completely at your mercy or shooting off their head and destroying their control scheme... Ooooooooh, I get goosebumps just thinking about it. Don't do that. It is frowned upon. This is an excellent game. Only play if you feel like having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023766716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1408757187}
review:
[b]I strongly do not recommend this game.[/b] 

Key reasons:
[list] [*]Poor matchmaking (both between robot tiers and player levels) [*] Lack of control on what game mode you wish to play [*] Constraining Inventory. [*] Problem with players using "hacks" [*] No notable support for the community. [*] No way to report offending players. [/list]
The matchmaking itself is pitiful at best, you can have teams set up in such a way where all the experienced (sometimes even veterans) players are on one team, and all the new people are on the other. So it seems it does not balance player levels, only robot tiers. Sadly it is very difficult to find any decent games with anything above a T2 robo (it goes up to 10). At T3 I am lucky to be able to to score a 2v2 match, which often ends up including T4 bots (on the opposing team), with just the T3 going vs the T4.

You cannot choose what game mode you want to play, and yet there are daily missions that ask for very specific things such as "win x amount of team deathmatch/bomb squad/capture the battery games" and countless other daily missions that require you to be the one to fulfill the objective of such matches, which is exceedingly difficult, because not only are you unable to choose your game mode, but far more often than not, players treat every match (regardless of game mode) more like it is team deathmatch.

Inventory is also constricting enough to strongly encourage using some $$ to expand it, though you can get most if not all things from simply playing the game ... the time it would take to achieve such things will really have you question if its worth it, especially with the quality of the game as it is now.

There is apparently also a problem with people using auto-target and wallhack cheats, I have been in games where not even 5 seconds in, I would be getting shot by an enemy using railguns (in the suburbia map) across 5 walls, not being in line of sight, and not even firing in my direction (evident by bullet trails into the sky in another direction).

Lastly, it seems there is no real support for the community, as there have been countless times when i have seen the chat being absolutely flooded with spam (with no apparent chat bans or otherwise), and throughout the weeks I have been playing it I have not seen any key updates to solve any of the major problems of the game. In fact, a report button seems non-existent! So with that I feel we can probably assume the game developers arent that interested in really keeping the game in a good shape it should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005529593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1425063045}
review:
Офигенный трэшачок про сборку своего собственного робота и пострелушки на арене.

Причем баланс сильно влияет на игровой процесс: как болвана соберешь, так он и поедет. Особенно здорово это проявляется в противостоянии - быстрый робот - мощный робот. Таким образом, дуэли становятся интересными.

Иными словами, процесс создания своей вооруженной микроволновки действительно увлекателен, благодаря интересной системе сборки деталей [а именно их комбинаций], чем то напоминает Spore. Кроме того, приятная графика, неплохйо санудтрек для Free-To-Play игры, и вообще - игрушка имеет свой стиль, чего довольно сложно достичь в наше время всяким клонам CS и Dota.

Из минусов:
 -  Всего 1 раунд в каждом матче. - 
 -  Бои 5х5, хотя это не столь уж большой минус: дуэли 1х1 в каком-нибудь закоулке довольно интересны даже мне, любителю стратегий "1000 на 1000 юнитов, КРОВЬКИШКИМЯСО ПОЛКИ МАРШИРУЮТ ПО КАРТЕ НАБИГАЯ НА ВСЕХ ПОДРЯД!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!". - 
 -  Пока только 3 режима игры: Deathmatch, захват флага [в данном конкретнмо случае батареек], и - неожиданно - установить бомбу/обезвредить бомбу [по мне, так гениально - ввести это старый добрый трюк из CS. Тем более стелс-девайс сразу становится куда полезней].

Одним словом, я не ожидал от Free-To-Play такого сюрприза. Конечно, потом все скатится в сплошной донат. Но может случиться чудо, и разработчики примут систему Team Fortress 2 - дабы донат не влиял на игровой процесс.

Естественно, я рекомендую эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1408520956}
review:
I am a fan of Guns and Robots, I will admit at first I was skeptical about G'n'R but after I found out what parts I was best with, I wil admit I started having a lot of fun. There is a huge amount of part combinations, but I will admit many of them are nearly useless. It is important to try lots of parts and see what you are best with, otherwise you may be in for a tough time.

 I like that there is no pay to win in game, everything can be unlockied in game, and to make matters better I have never had to grind for anything, I actually have too much currency! How often does that happen in a free to play shooter? There are also a good amount of cosmetics and paints to decorate your many many robot parts with, and there are a decent amount of maps and game modes as well. You probably won't get bored  fast. 

Overall I recommend this game to anyone looking for a good free to play shooter, lots of customizations, lots of weapons, and  a good mixture of game modes and maps. and best of all no pay to win!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040011956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1410984576}
review: I was looking around for a free to play game that looked fun and wasn't pay to win. I came across Guns and Robots and decided to try it out. Next thing I knew, I was playing it so much on the first try. The customization is awesome, and its just so fun and addicting, making you find out which combinations suit your little tin bucket the best. There are very few elements of pay2win (from what I've seen). It merely just adds convenience and allows you get to better things faster. If you don't pay anything, it will only take longer. Which I'm fine with. More time to play the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994969135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1408393369}
review:
Do not take me bad, this game can be fun.
But sadly the crafting mechanics is so poor that it makes the game unplayable for me.
There is no ability to plan your bot without buing those parts, UI is unintuitive & u cant even sell parts u dont need (only for 0 gold which equals trashing them)
Premium currency can be earned by playing, nice excuse to sell power.

I recomend Robocraft (too f2p here on Steam).

author: {'steamid': '76561197988569001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2336, 'last_played': 1411283621}
review:
LOADS of weapons, and you can use up to 4 of them in any combination you want on your robot. If you use 4 you will be slow, so most of the times you will be using 2 of them, but its okay since the balance is needed. It has 'capture the batteries (flag)',  "plant the bomb" and "team deathmatch" modes. The game is soo funn, and there is no time limit before you get bored because your robot is simply 100% customisable. Every part (chassis, body, head, weapons and , yes, HATS) has around 10 different models on shop with different status so you can make the perfect robot for your style. Its like Team fortress, loadout and robocraft combined. 
The downside is that it is new so it still have some problems like having only a few maps and some balance problems (there was a specific very overpowered wepon but it got nerfed yesterday, but still some are clearly stronger than others). But at least every weapon cost basically the same and it is not pay-to-win since you can earn all the currency just playing. The only 'pay to win' thing here (too expensive to buy just playing it normally) are cosmetic things, like hats and painting. All in All, it gives loads of fun but need new maps. Would recommend for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059789750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1407863862}
review:
I played this game once, but I didn't like it afterwards...
Sorry if this isn't much, I didn't play much of the game...

Some Pros:
+ "Loadout"... Etc...
+ You get a free robot to start off with! He's your friend until you find a better robot.
+ The tutorial is understandable.
+ You get credits, even if you lose.

Some Cons:
- You can't lower the resolution or quality, hence, you have to give up the tutorial and guess the game.
- Selecting weapons actually disables them.
- Matchmaking isn't available.
- YOLO. (In game)
- The jump button didn't work. At least, it didn't work for starting people. They would need an upgrade, or something. I guess...
- If you lose, you have to pay credits (not real money) to rebuild your robot. Technically, you are one credit away from what you want, because you spent it on your robot's repairs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090774661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1408533991}
review: Неплохая игра, в боях присутствует небольшой дизбаланс(вышел в бой 1ый раз, были довольно прокаченые роботы в обоих командах), а так еще бы русский язык добавили вообще бы хорошо было. 8 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085469528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1408277458}
review:
Interesting concept, but just doesn't work. I was taken in by the good reviews but this is not a game I'd recommend to anyone. The controls alternate between being clunky in game and overly sensitive in the crafting stage, the tutorial is too short to really explain things properly and left me scratching my head with the game mechanics. Obviously there are supposed to be pros and cons to each weapon and part but how they affect your stats isn't explained anywhere in game (even the stats themselves aren't explained). The targeting/damage system is a nice feature, but doesn't really work since accuracy is all over the place.

Overall I'd say, nice concept but needs more spit and polish (I'm just glad it's free so I haven't lost anything).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991038894', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1412977888}
review:
WHile it could be nice to experience something new once in a while, the moment you understand that you just wasting your time on some stupid farming is killshot.

Game itself ais not well balanced. Here and there you oculd get wiped by some uber-sniper shot, and some flea-swarming lowtechs just wont die..

What is ruining - Pay-to-Win party. You can boost "sparks" into upgrades.

Also matchmaking is pain. Tired to be placed in newbs teams - they rolling around without any basic sense of teamwork.


Overall - it was fun. Thank you Developers team!
Thought something much bigger then lobby matches is welcome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046168138', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1408312302}
review: I WOULD recommend this game, if it wasnt pay to win... He, seriously, being one shot as a heavy robot by a random shot across the map by someone who destroyed, ad the end, your whole team in one (na, 4 cannons) shot is heavily unbalanced. You can't play melee since every enemy is heavy range, most of the map have 2 chokepoints and its almost impossible to go through, expect by sneaking, and most of the time, there is a heavy machine gun spamming the pass... Can be good, but hell cashers > any other player, just like most of f2p atm :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198014722119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1408165071}
review:
Uninstalled very quickly. The majority of the game belies inside of 'Customization', and by customization, players generally think "Hey, I can look different than schmuck number X256!", but no.

Seriously, this game still uses 'rental' features for cosmetics and some items. Rental features went out of style when people quit playing Combat Arms, I don't know why they thought it'd be a good idea here. Basically, you're going to be stuck with Robot Scrapula until the end of days unless you want to play for hundreds of hours, OR you can pay out the butt and get some cool laser cannon, and some headgear, for some cash.

The tutorial on how to use the shop was longer than how to play the game, I think that's example enough of what this game is all about.

review: GUNS and ROBOTS is engaging third person shooter with inventive character design and an endless list of customization features. The game combines fun art with almost unlimited game play. The characters are able to move freely all over the maps, engage in battles, climb up the rankings and unlock various achievements. They will be able to choose their equipment from variety of weapons and over 150 different parts. The incredible battle mechanics combined with funny looking robots adds a whole new perspective to the genre

author: {'steamid': '76561197999239322', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1407898207}
review: Very simple: I'm tired of trying games that haven't been properly tested. Game started up in Nvidia Surround across 3 monitors just fine. Tutorial got me as far as the workbench and no farther. At that resolution, which is one of those listed under options, the workbench area is offscreen. I had to stop the tutorial to fix and post bug to forum. Went back in game to give another chance, and the tutorial had backed up a few steps, wanting me to spend in-game money I had already spent... so I couldn't continue tutorial because I no longer have money to buy parts I already own. All of this less than 10 minutes into game. Spare yourself the grief. Graphics suck anyway. Not even worth the bandwidth to download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053521982', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1407886401}
review:
My suggestion is: HIGHLY AVOID THIS GAME!

The problem with game is there are specific robot builds that dominate maing the game unenjoyable. You do get slightly gimped trying to play without paying actual money. Also, if you have a problem with the game not working their support is very unhelpful and most likely you wont be able to play again.

For me I really enjoyed the game when I first played. That lasted for about 20mins before the game decided to bug out and I was no longer able to load into the game. They never responded to my support ticket, until I finally made an angry forum post. It was shortly after they made a post saying they fixed the game. Unfortuantly the game still didnt work and they asked people to send in more info. After doing so I have gotten no response in days and they preceeded to post saying they have fixed peoples problems. And guess what... the game still doesn't work.

Please take my advice and stay far away from this game. Don't waste your time or money. This game isn't anywhere near ready to be on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077509479', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1475195844}
review: Hear me out on this one, this is NOT a typical ,"oh, that's overpowered? FIX IT!" kind of game. Overpowered weapons are EVERYWHERE!!! Honestly, there's a lot of weapons that can kill you in basically 1 shot. But! But, that doesn't mean it's a bad game. Seeing your character just explode into bits by an op weapon is part of why this game is perfect if you want some laughs. You can be The Tank (These are my names for them as just "Light, Heavy, and Medium" just seem to have no life in their names. These are not the official names, and never will be.) , and have 4 Weapons, heavy armour, and generally be, an all around boss. Or, there's The Light Mice, Scurrying about, and being just plain annoying, but are so fun to play as! Then there's the Classics, with medium everything. The perfect mix between speen and firepower. Perfect for starters. Or you can go custum, and make some sort of weak armour, heavy weapons abomination. And that is what makes the game fun. One  criticism, Devs. Please fix this. The map "Siege" is too unbalances. I rarely win as the Outlaws, but rarely lose as the Regulators. That's my one problem with the whole game. Keep it up Devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1407498535}
review:
Roboty i Działa. Da się to przegryźć? Wiele firm ostatnio tworzy gry gdzie walczymy robotami, które budujemy z najróżniejszych części. Jednym z takich sukcesów był Robocraft. Czy Guns and Robots się wybije?

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mdgR_ca8p2M

[b]Zalety Guns and Robots[/b]
- Bardzo duża ilość opcji i elementów z jakich możemy zbudować nasze roboty (działka, korpusy, napędy, głowy, baterie, modyfikacje)
- Niskie wymagania sprzętowe (potrzebny jest tylko lepszy toster)
- Drobniaki waluty premium możemy zdobywać za dzienne misje, acziwmenty i levelowanie
- Przyjemna rozgrywka kiedy już strzelamy się naszym czołgiem, która nie wymaga wielkiej zręczności, wiedzy czy umiejętności

[b]Wady Guns and Robots[/b]
- Trochę toporna, typowo "rosyjska" mechanika gry, w której ciężko poczuć czy nasza broń jest faktycznie dobra, czy jednak mieliśmy tylko trochę szczęścia
- Skomplikowana dla początkujących mechanika budowy pojazdów

review:

When you finally do get to battle other players, they stick you against dbags that purposely build smurf bots to rocket spam the shit out of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033878096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1407999867}
review:
Great concept and graphics, but here are the failures that make it not playable at the moment.

1. The matches are ENTIRELY too short. I'm talking 30 seconds to 3 mins max. It takes longer to queue and ready up for a match than it does to actually play it.

2. No sufficient tutorial. I ended up wasting a lot of currency because the game did not explain what to do to a reasonable degree. I'm still not sure how to take components out of the items.

3. There is NO respawn, which in turn is part of the reason the matches are so short. Everyone dies in 3 minutes or less, game over. You didn't get to play so now you're back to waiting to queue for another match which will be the same exact boring match where you either die quickly and don't play, or the match ends up ending a few minutes later.

4. There's not as much customization as the game lets on. Some things clearly work better than others, and many of the options are redundant. You'll never have a need to mix and match so many things, you'll just want to go with what works better than other things, and it will become obvious quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118966056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1412920639}
review:
As someone who hates pvp and only played this game because of a playfire reward, I was very surprised on how much fun I was having. The games go quick and the rewards are fair, even if you are on the losing side. As this is a f2p game, you will see players in super trumped up bots but I never felt like I had no chance against them. In fact after just a couple hours of learning my robot and upgrading, I was able to hold my own in most matches I played in. 

I would recommend at least giving the game a look to see if it fits your playstyle.

review: This game has a great concept, and it's a lot of fun to be able to build your own robot, but it is extremely tedious to navigate the menus, and it constantly jumps you around them. It often glitches out and causes you to be completely unable to click on anything, and the only way to fix it is to restart your game.
